Corpus ID: 56784121
Digital surface representation and the constructibility of Gehry's architecture
@inproceedings{Shelden2002DigitalSR,
  title={Digital surface representation and the constructibility of Gehry's architecture},
  author={Dennis R. Shelden},
  year={2002},
  url={https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:56784121}
}Dennis R. Shelden
Published 2002
Engineering, Computer Science
TLDR


This thesis presents work in the development of computational descriptions of Gehry’s architectural forms, focusing on the digital representation of surface geometry and its capacity for describing the constructibility of building enclosure systems.Expand

No Paper Link Available

Design computing of complex-curved geometry using digital fabrication methods
K. GriffithComputer Science, Engineering
2006
TLDR


The production of design information for digital fabrication is presented in this thesis and the evaluation processes used by architects when evaluating digitally fabricated desktop models are explored.Expand

Computation and construction of vault geometry prototypes
S. DattaM. SharmanStuart HanafinT. ChangComputer Science, Engineering
2011
TLDR


Three different approaches in the translation from digital to physical models are investigated: rapid prototyping, two-dimensional surface models in paper and structural component models using CNC fabrication, identifying a body of knowledge in the design and prototyping of Gaussian vaults.Expand

CAADRIA proceedings
2007
TLDR

Get Real towards Performance-Driven Computational Geometry
N. OxmanComputer Science, Engineering
2007
TLDR


This work explores the relation between geometry and performance from a computational-geometry perspective by revisiting certain analytical tools offered in most of today's 3-D modelers which support the evaluation of any generated surface geometry specifically curvature and draft angle analysis.Expand

E. CalderonEngineering, Computer Science
2011
